column4: I can't connect to wireless with my broadcom on a dell inspiron.
any help?
the light won't turn on on the hardware, either.
It's a Broadcom B43 wireless driver
In "Hardware Drivers" the check box is enabled, and it says In use
but when I right click on the network icon and select networks, nothing shows.
The ATI driver is working great, compiz is up and running beautifully.
The laptop is a Dell Inspiron 1721, I'm sure this problem is not unusual.
I looked up ndiswrapper stuff, but I'm not sure if I need it since the hardware is listed under the Hardware Drivers applet.
Has anybody gotten their little LED to light up under hardy?
lspci -nv|grep -i broadcom
er
lspci -v|grep -i broadcom
thanks.
what does the latter command give you/
BCM94311MCG wlan mini-PCI (rev 01)
you don't need ndiswrapper.  That chipset works fine with 8.04.1's b43 driver and b43-fwcutter.
OK, so how do I turn it on and connect to a network then?
Does the LED ever come on?
see the wiki.  Yes, it does.  Sorry, I need to run.
